description_txt: stated on January 15, 2014 in his state of state speech:
quote_txt: "Since I took office in January 2011, we have created 11,100 Rhode Island-based jobs."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2014 in an interview on NFL.com:
quote_txt: "The extra point is almost automatic. … (The NFL) had five missed extra points this year out of 1,200 some odd" attempts.

description_txt: stated on January 29, 2014 in a press conference:
quote_txt: Cuba has "a lower child mortality rate than ours. Their life expectancy is now greater than ours."

description_txt: stated on January 29, 2014 in a Fox Sports panel about Super Bowl XLVIII:
quote_txt: Says Marshawn Lynch is "second all-time in terms of average yards per rush only to Terrell Davis."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in comments from sports pundits and fans on Twitter:
quote_txt: Says Peyton Manning struggles in cold weather games.

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2014 in a campaign website:
quote_txt: Says Alex Sink "even supported a tax on homeowners insurance policies."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2014 in the Texas Debate hosted by KERA-TV, Channel 13, in Dallas:
quote_txt: David Dewhurst is "the first lieutenant governor in history to have a personal security detail."

description_txt: stated on January 9, 2014 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: "Every year since Gov. Walker and the Republicans have been in control of the Legislature we’ve created fewer jobs, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics."

description_txt: stated on January 29, 2014 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "It still had not gotten terrible on the roads" by 2 to 3 p.m. Tuesday.

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2014 in a speech.:
quote_txt: Virginia is "the No. 1 recipient of federal dollars."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in a speech:
quote_txt: "I never gave up custody of my children. I never lost custody of my children."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in a response to the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: Says President Barack Obama "spent nearly a trillion dollars on make-work government jobs."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in comments on the NFL Network:
quote_txt: Quarterbacks "won the (Super Bowl) MVP more than 50 percent of the time."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in comments on ESPN:
quote_txt: "I played in a game here against the Pittsburgh Steelers where there was 23 inches of snow. … We played in at least 15 inches of that."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2014 in comments on ESPN's "Mike & Mike":
quote_txt: "The majority of teams (are) now spending their dollars on the offensive side of the football."

description_txt: stated on January 8, 2014 in an opinion column in the Austin American-Statesman:
quote_txt: Nearly 90% of Travis County government races will be settled by the time of the Democratic primary.

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2014 in a Providence Journal commentary:
quote_txt: "Of the 20 bills [Rep. David] Cicilline has sponsored in his three years in office, not a single one has advanced past the embryonic committee stage."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • January 30, 2014

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in an interview:
quote_txt: "We have been confronted with an unexpected storm that has hit the metropolitan area."

description_txt: stated on January 29, 2014 in a broadcast of Fox News' "The Kelly File":
quote_txt: Says "Barack Obama has gone from blaming George W. Bush to plagiarizing George W. Bush."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: Women "make 77 cents for every dollar a man earns."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "For the first time in over a decade, business leaders around the world have declared that China is no longer the world’s No. 1 place to invest; America is."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in State of the Union speech:
quote_txt: "Every four minutes, another American home or business goes solar."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2014 in a press release about his education budget proposal:
quote_txt: "The $18.8 billion in funding for K-12 education funding is the highest in Florida history and includes a record $10.6 billion in state funds."

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2014 in an online commentary:
quote_txt: "25% of human trafficking victims are located in Texas."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in a floor debate.:
quote_txt: On sharing power with Republicans

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "The federal minimum wage is worth about 20 percent less than it was when Ronald Reagan" gave his first address to a joint session of Congress.

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in the Republican response to the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "Last month, more Americans stopped looking for a job than found one."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "Over the past eight years, the United States has reduced our total carbon pollution more than any other nation on Earth."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: There is "more oil produced at home than we buy from the rest of the world – the first time that’s happened in nearly 20 years."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2014 in the State of Union address:
quote_txt: During the past four years, "average wages have barely budged."
